arsenal.name: classic
arsenal.discription: The pistol you always get for free at the beginning of each round, it’s serviceable with two firing modes: mouse-1 for single bullet (more accurate at a distance) or mouse-2 for a three bullet burst (better in close quarters).

arsenal.name: Shorty
arsenal.discription: A sawed-off shotgun that is solid in close quarters, just beware it only has two shots before having to reload.

arsenal.name: Frenzy
arsenal.discription: The equivalent of CS:GO’s CZ75-Auto. Has a strong recoil but good in close and short range with burst fire, decent at longer ranges if you’re tapping for one or two bullets. Try it out if you like SMGs.

arsenal.name: Ghost
arsenal.discription: The only sidearm with a silencer. Precision is key with this gun as you’ll need to get headshot, but luckily it doesn’t have much recoil.

arsenal.name: Sheriff
arsenal.discription: The most expensive but most powerful of the sidearms. The equivalent of the Desert Eagle from CS:GO.

arsenal.name: Stinger
arsenal.discription: Has an incredible high rate of fire but only good at close range from hip due to the amount of recoil/spray it has.

arsenal.name: Spectre
arsenal.discription: Has an incredible high rate of fire but only good at close range from hip due to the amount of recoil/spray it has.

arsenal.name: Bucky
arsenal.discription: Shotgun with two firing modes, mouse-1 is a regular shotgun blast but mouse-two is similar to Roadhog’s right click from Overwatch.
Alt fire: Semi-Automatic Air Burst (extended primary fire shot)

arsenal.name: Judge
arsenal.discription: An automatic shotgun with a high rate of fire. Good for dueling at close range.
